com.github.yeetmanlord.zeta_core.api.uitl.raycast

Class RayCastUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.yeetmanlord.zeta_core.api.uitl.raycast.RayCastUtility

  • public class RayCastUtility
extends java.lang.Object
    Version independent ray-cast. Will ray-cast from an entities eye location with its pitch and yaw. Will stop on hitting either an entity or a block. If it hits neither it will return an ResultType.EMPTY with a null entity and block.
    All tests were run using a 1.16.5 server with 2GB of RAM using the highest preciseness. For rayCastBlocks(LivingEntity, double, boolean, Precision) I used RayCastUtility.Precision.PRECISE_BLOCK, for rayCastEntities(LivingEntity, double, boolean, Precision) I used RayCastUtility.Precision.PRECISE_ENTITY and for rayCast(LivingEntity, double, boolean, Precision) I used RayCastUtility.Precision.PRECISE_ENTITY
    TEST RESULTS:
    NOTE: Entity results will very, based on how many entities are loaded.
      Block Ray-Cast: 80.07 ms, Precision: RayCastUtility.Precision.PRECISE_BLOCK
        Successfully completed 1000 ray-casts
        TPS: No noticeable TPS change.

      Entity Ray-Cast: 395.43 ms, Precision: RayCastUtility.Precision.PRECISE_ENTITY
        Successfully completed 1000 ray-casts
        TPS: No noticeable TPS change.

      Full Ray-Cast (Block and entity): 437.01 ms, Precision: RayCastUtility.Precision.PRECISE_ENTITY
        Successfully completed 1000 ray-casts
        TPS: No noticeable TPS change.

      Block Ray-Cast: 61.64 ms, Precision: RayCastUtility.Precision.ACCURATE_BLOCK

        Successfully completed 1000 ray-casts
        TPS: No noticeable TPS change.

      Entity Ray-Cast: 225.14 ms, Precision: RayCastUtility.Precision.ACCURATE_ENTITY
        Successfully completed 1000 ray-casts
        TPS: No noticeable TPS change.

      Full Ray-Cast (Block and entity): 253.52 ms, Precision: RayCastUtility.Precision.ACCURATE_ENTITY
        Successfully completed 1000 ray-casts
        TPS: No noticeable TPS change.

      Block Ray-Cast: 71.90 ms (Lol, wow), Precision: RayCastUtility.Precision.SEMI_ACCURATE_BLOCK

        Successfully completed 1000 ray-casts
        TPS: No noticeable TPS change.

      Entity Ray-Cast: 97.18 ms (Wow that's a lot of improvement), Precision: RayCastUtility.Precision.SEMI_ACCURATE_ENTITY
        Successfully completed 1000 ray-casts
        TPS: No noticeable TPS change.

      Full Ray-Cast (Block and entity): 177.97 ms, Precision: RayCastUtility.Precision.SEMI_ACCURATE_ENTITY
        Successfully completed 1000 ray-casts
        TPS: No noticeable TPS change.

      Block Ray-Cast: 61.22 ms, Precision: RayCastUtility.Precision.IMPRECISE_BLOCK

        Successfully completed 1000 ray-casts
        TPS: No noticeable TPS change.

      Entity Ray-Cast: 71.96 ms, Precision: RayCastUtility.Precision.IMPRECISE_ENTITY
        Successfully completed 1000 ray-casts
        TPS: No noticeable TPS change.

      Full Ray-Cast (Block and entity): 120.24 ms, Precision: RayCastUtility.Precision.IMPRECISE_ENTITY
        Successfully completed 1000 ray-casts
        TPS: No noticeable TPS change.

    VERDICT: You should probably use RayCastUtility.Precision.ACCURATE_BLOCK and I think you should probably use RayCastUtility.Precision.PRECISE_ENTITY or RayCastUtility.Precision.ACCURATE_ENTITY. Despite those being resource hogs they are the only accurate way. (Sadly)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  RayCastUtility.Precision
      My general advice for entity ray-casting is to just use RayCastUtility.Precision.PRECISE_ENTITY, sorry or if you're willing to have some hit or miss use RayCastUtility.Precision.ACCURATE_ENTITY.

    • Method Detail

      • rayCastBlocks

        public static BlockRayCastResult rayCastBlocks(org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity entity,
                                               double maxDistance,
                                               boolean ignoreLiquids,
                                               RayCastUtility.Precision precision)
        Ray-casts only blocks. Doesn't affect performance very much. Using a 1.16.5 server and calling this 1000 times, there was minimal tps issue. (Using the highest preciseness)
        Parameters:
        entity - Entity to ray-cast from
        maxDistance - Maximum distance to ray-cast
        ignoreLiquids - Whether to factor in liquids. If true, will not stop ray-casting at a liquid.
        precision - How many blocks (or fractions of) to advance before every next check
        Returns:
        A ray-casted block result or an empty block result

      • rayCastEntities

        public static EntityRayCastResult rayCastEntities(org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity entity,
                                                  double maxDistance,
                                                  boolean ignoreLiquids,
                                                  RayCastUtility.Precision precision)
        Ray-casts only entities. Affect performance quite a bit. Using a 1.16.5 server and calling this 1000 time, it took quite a bit of time. (Using the highest preciseness)
        Parameters:
        entity - Entity to ray-cast from
        maxDistance - Maximum distance to ray-cast
        ignoreLiquids - Whether to factor in liquids. If true, will not stop ray-casting at a liquid.
        precision - How many blocks (or fractions of) to advance before every next check
        Returns:
        A ray-casted entity result or an empty entity result

      • rayCast

        public static RayCastResult rayCast(org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity entity,
                                    double maxDistance,
                                    boolean ignoreLiquids,
                                    RayCastUtility.Precision precision)
        Ray-casts entities and blocks. Affect performance quite a bit. Using a 1.16.5 server and calling this 1000 times, it took quite a bit of time. (Using the highest preciseness)
        Parameters:
        entity - Entity to ray-cast from
        maxDistance - Maximum distance to ray-cast
        ignoreLiquids - Whether to factor in liquids. If true, will not stop ray-casting at a liquid.
        precision - How many blocks (or fractions of) to advance before every next check
        Returns:
        A ray-cast result or an empty result

      • executeStepByStep

        public static void executeStepByStep(org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity entity,
                                     double maxDistance,
                                     boolean ignoreLiquids,
                                     double stepSize,
                                     boolean ignoreEntities,
                                     java.util.function.Consumer<org.bukkit.Location> onStep,
                                     @Nullable
                                     java.util.function.Consumer<RayCastResult> onRayCastFinish)
        Ray-casts from entities eye location and executes specified code at each step.
        Parameters:
        entity - Entity to ray-cast from
        maxDistance - Maximum distance to ray-cast
        ignoreLiquids - Whether to factor in liquids. If true, will not stop ray-casting at a liquid.
        stepSize - How many blocks to advance forward before next check. If you specified 0.5D, it will check every half block.
        ignoreEntities - Whether to stop the ray-casting once it hits an entity
        onStep - Code to execute at each step
        onRayCastFinish - Code to execute when ray-casting is finished

      • getRayTraceLocation

        public static org.bukkit.Location getRayTraceLocation(org.bukkit.Location starting,
                                                      org.bukkit.util.Vector direction,
                                                      double distance)
